title: Comprehensive UX Enhancement Package: Loading States, Tournament Experience, Navigation, Visual Polish, and Enhanced Sponsor Visibility

requirements.text: Implement skeleton loading screens across all major pages (TournamentDashboard, TournamentDetailPage, LeaderboardPage, ProfilePage, WalletPage, NotificationsPage, StatisticsDashboard, SquadsPage, ReferralDashboard, AdminDashboard) that display content structure placeholders while data is being fetched, replacing generic spinners with page-specific skeleton layouts that mirror the actual content structure
acceptanceCriteria: Each major page displays a skeleton screen with placeholder boxes matching the page's content layout
Skeleton screens appear immediately when navigating to a page before data loads
Skeleton animations provide visual feedback that content is loading
Once data loads, skeleton screens smoothly transition to actual content

requirements.text: Create helpful and specific error messages throughout the application that clearly explain what went wrong and provide actionable next steps, replacing generic error alerts with context-aware messages for common failure scenarios including network errors, authentication failures, validation errors, and backend operation failures
acceptanceCriteria: Error messages clearly state what went wrong in user-friendly language
Each error message includes actionable guidance on how to resolve the issue
Error styling is consistent across all components using toast notifications or inline error displays
Critical errors are distinguished from warnings with appropriate visual hierarchy

requirements.text: Design empty state screens for all list and collection views including tournament lists when no tournaments exist, notifications center when no notifications exist, wallet transaction list when no transactions exist, squad member lists when no members exist, and leaderboards when no data exists, each with relevant illustrations or icons, helpful text explaining the empty state, and clear call-to-action buttons to populate the section
acceptanceCriteria: Each empty state displays a relevant icon or illustration
Empty state text clearly explains why the section is empty and what users can do
Call-to-action buttons guide users toward populating the empty section
Empty states match the gaming theme with consistent styling

requirements.text: Add success animations and visual feedback for key user actions including tournament registration confirmation, profile update success, wallet transaction submission, squad creation, comment posting, and admin operations, using smooth fade-in animations, checkmark icons, and celebratory micro-interactions that provide clear confirmation without being intrusive
acceptanceCriteria: Success animations appear immediately after completing key actions
Animations are smooth, brief (under 1 second), and non-blocking
Success feedback includes visual indicators like checkmarks or glow effects
Animations are consistent across all success scenarios throughout the app

requirements.text: Enhance mobile responsiveness across all pages by improving touch targets to minimum 44px, optimizing layouts for small screens with single-column stacking, ensuring readable font sizes without zooming, making navigation menus mobile-friendly with hamburger menu or bottom nav, ensuring all modals and forms are usable on phone screens, and testing all interactive elements for touch usability
acceptanceCriteria: All buttons and interactive elements have minimum 44px touch targets on mobile
Layouts automatically stack vertically on screens smaller than 768px
Text remains readable at default mobile zoom levels without horizontal scrolling
Navigation menu collapses into a mobile-friendly format on small screens
All forms and modals are fully functional and usable on phone screens

requirements.text: Redesign TournamentCard component to show visual information at a glance by adding game mode icons (Solo/Duo/Squad), highlighting prize pool with larger typography and neon glow effects, displaying slot availability with progress bars or visual indicators, showing entry fee prominently with currency formatting, and adding status badges for tournament state with color-coded visual hierarchy
acceptanceCriteria: Tournament cards display game mode with custom icons for Solo/Duo/Squad
Prize pool is prominently displayed with neon glow effect matching the gaming theme
Slot availability shows visual progress bar indicating remaining slots
Entry fee is clearly visible with BDT currency formatting
Tournament status (Open/Full/Started/Completed) uses color-coded badges

requirements.text: Streamline tournament registration flow by reducing the registration process to fewer clicks, pre-filling user information where available, showing registration confirmation immediately without page reload, displaying room ID and password in a prominent modal with copy-to-clipboard functionality, and providing clear feedback at each step of the registration process
acceptanceCriteria: Tournament registration completes in maximum 2 clicks for users with complete profiles
Registration button directly triggers the registration flow without intermediate modals
Success confirmation appears immediately with tournament details
Room ID and password are displayed in an easy-to-read modal with copy buttons
Each registration step provides clear visual feedback on progress

requirements.text: Add clear visual status indicators to tournament cards and detail pages showing Open status with green accent when registration is available, Full status with orange accent when all slots are filled, Started status with cyan accent when tournament is in progress, and Completed status with gray accent when tournament has ended, using color-coded badges, icons, and text labels that are immediately recognizable
acceptanceCriteria: Each tournament status uses distinct color coding: green for Open, orange for Full, cyan for Started, gray for Completed
Status badges include both text labels and icons for quick recognition
Status is prominently displayed on both tournament cards and detail pages
Status indicators match the gaming theme with neon-style styling

requirements.text: Improve visibility of remaining slots and registration deadlines on tournament cards and TournamentDetailPage by displaying remaining slots with fraction format (e.g., '8/20 slots remaining') and visual progress bar, showing registration deadline with countdown timer (e.g., 'Registration closes in 2 hours'), and highlighting urgent information when slots are low or deadline is near with warning colors
acceptanceCriteria: Remaining slots show both numeric fraction and visual progress bar
Registration deadline displays countdown timer with human-readable format
Low slot availability (under 25% remaining) triggers warning styling
Near deadline (under 24 hours) triggers urgent color highlighting
Slot and deadline information is prominently positioned on cards and detail pages

requirements.text: Reorganize the Header navigation menu for better information architecture by grouping related features together, prioritizing frequently accessed pages like Tournaments, My Profile, and Wallet in primary navigation, moving secondary features like Squads, Referrals, and Statistics to a sub-menu or user dropdown, and ensuring navigation labels are clear and descriptive
acceptanceCriteria: Primary navigation includes most frequently accessed pages: Tournaments, Wallet, Profile, Leaderboard
Secondary features are grouped in a dropdown or sub-menu
Navigation labels clearly describe their destination
Menu structure reduces cognitive load with logical grouping
Mobile navigation adapts the same structure for small screens

requirements.text: Enhance search and filter UX on TournamentDashboard by making the TournamentFilters component more intuitive with larger touch targets for filter options, adding real-time result count updates as filters are applied, providing clear visual feedback when filters are active, adding a 'Clear All Filters' button for easy reset, and improving the layout for better mobile usability
acceptanceCriteria: Filter controls have minimum 44px touch targets for mobile usability
Result count updates in real-time as users adjust filters
Active filters are visually highlighted with badges or indicators
Clear All Filters button appears when any filter is active
Filter panel layout adapts gracefully for mobile screens

requirements.text: Add shortcuts and quick access features to frequently used sections by creating a 'Quick Actions' floating action button or menu that provides one-click access to My Tournaments, Register for Tournament, Check Wallet Balance, and View Notifications, positioned strategically for easy thumb reach on mobile devices
acceptanceCriteria: Quick actions menu is accessible from all major pages
Menu includes shortcuts to: My Tournaments, Register, Wallet, Notifications
Button placement is optimized for mobile thumb reach (bottom-right corner)
Quick actions are visually distinct but not intrusive
Each shortcut navigates directly to the relevant page or opens relevant modal

requirements.text: Streamline wallet transaction flow on WalletPage by redesigning deposit and withdrawal cards with simplified forms requiring fewer fields, adding visual feedback for pending transactions, improving transaction history display with better categorization and filtering options, and making transaction details easier to understand with clear labels and formatting
acceptanceCriteria: Deposit and withdrawal forms require only essential fields
Pending transactions display with clear pending status badges and visual indicators
Transaction history can be filtered by type (deposits, withdrawals, winnings, fees)
Each transaction shows clear labels for amount, type, date, and status
Transaction amounts use consistent currency formatting throughout

requirements.text: Implement smooth page transitions throughout the application using fade-in animations when navigating between routes, smooth slide-in animations for modals and side panels, gentle fade animations for content appearing after loading, and ensuring all transitions are hardware-accelerated for 60fps performance
acceptanceCriteria: Page transitions use fade-in effect with 200-300ms duration
Modals slide in from center with scale and opacity animation
Content loaded asynchronously fades in smoothly
All animations maintain 60fps performance on modern devices
Animations can be interrupted smoothly without visual glitches

requirements.text: Improve contrast and readability across all UI components by ensuring text meets WCAG AA contrast standards (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text) against dark backgrounds, increasing font sizes for critical information like prize pools and tournament titles, adjusting neon colors where they compromise readability, and ensuring all interactive elements have sufficient visual weight
acceptanceCriteria: All text meets WCAG AA contrast requirements against backgrounds
Important information uses larger font sizes (18px+ for titles, 16px+ for body)
Neon accent colors are used decoratively while maintaining readable text
Interactive elements have clear visual boundaries with sufficient contrast
Font weights are adjusted for optimal readability on dark backgrounds

requirements.text: Apply consistent spacing and alignment across all pages and components by establishing a unified spacing system using multiples of 4px (4, 8, 16, 24, 32px), ensuring consistent padding and margins for cards and containers, aligning form elements consistently, standardizing gap spacing in grid and flex layouts, and maintaining consistent component sizing throughout the application
acceptanceCriteria: All spacing uses 4px base unit (spacing scale: 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 24, 32)
Cards and containers have consistent padding (16px mobile, 24px desktop)
Form elements maintain consistent spacing between fields (16px)
Grid and flex gaps use standardized values (8px, 16px, 24px)
Component heights follow consistent sizing (buttons 44px, inputs 40px)

requirements.text: Create engaging button states with clear visual feedback by implementing hover effects with neon glow intensification, active/pressed states with subtle scale transform, disabled states with reduced opacity and grayscale filter, loading states with spinner animations, and ensuring all state transitions are smooth with 150-200ms duration
acceptanceCriteria: Hover states intensify neon glow effects on buttons
Active states scale buttons to 98% with transform animation
Disabled buttons show 50% opacity with grayscale filter
Loading states display spinner while maintaining button dimensions
All state transitions animate smoothly in 150-200ms

requirements.text: Build a new enhanced sponsor visibility system completely separate from existing Code 11 branding that displays animated sponsor banners on all major pages including TournamentDashboard, TournamentDetailPage, AdminDashboard, LeaderboardPage, ProfilePage, WalletPage, NotificationsPage, StatisticsDashboard, SquadsPage, and ReferralDashboard, featuring eye-catching animations like slide-in, fade pulse, or subtle scale effects, prominent placement in header or hero sections, and clear sponsor logo and text that makes Code 11 sponsorship highly visible and engaging

quotes: a completely new system separate from the existing Code 11 integration

acceptanceCriteria: Animated sponsor banner appears on all 10 major pages listed
Banner includes Code 11 logo with prominent sizing
Animation effects include slide-in, fade pulse, or scale that draw attention
Banner placement is strategic (top of page or hero section) for maximum visibility
Animation loops subtly without being intrusive or distracting
Banner design matches gaming theme with neon highlights
System is completely independent from existing Code 11 branding features

constraints: Must respect frontend immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui
All animations must maintain 60fps performance on modern devices
Mobile responsiveness must support screens as small as 320px width
Must maintain dark gaming theme with neon highlights throughout all enhancements
Enhanced sponsor system must not conflict with or replace existing Code 11 branding
nonGoals: Backend implementation changes are not required for these UX enhancements
Do not modify authentication flows or Internet Identity integration
Do not change existing tournament business logic or registration rules
Do not alter wallet balance calculation or transaction processing
Do not modify admin authorization or access control systems
Do not integrate external animation libraries beyond existing dependencies
